parameters: Father: Hey, \.you're back.
Father: Did you hear about the school shooting that
happened in Kansas?
Yes, \.I have.
Father: There's so much violence in the youth these
days.
Father: Kids only watch and play violent media now and
it's really affecting them.
Father: You kids just mimic whatever things you see.\.
There's no reason in you kids.
Father: That's why I don't want you playing those games.
Yeah, well. \. I'm gonna do homework now.
A
*Just Yesterday*
*Kansas school shooting leaving 9 dead and 13 injured.*
Another shooting?
I really gotta get to school though so I can't watch
any longer.
(You turned off the TV.)
(I know it doesn't look it but the software
doesn't have a TV that was turned off as one of the
assets so just trust me)
*Just Yesterday*
*Kansas school shooting leaving 9 dead and 13 injured.*
Another shooting?
I really gotta get to school though so I can't watch
any longer.
(You turned off the TV.)
(I know it doesn't look it but the software
doesn't have a TV that was turned off as one of the
assets so just trust me)
The TV's on.
Must've been left on last night.
Should probably turn it off before I go.
The TV's on.
Must've been left on last night.
Should probably turn it off before I go.
This is my dad's room. \.\. Probably shouldn't go in.
I should turn off the TV before I leave.
I can't go out, \.\. I have homework to do.
I should turn off the TV before I leave.
I can't go out, \.\. I have homework to do.
I should turn off the TV before I leave.
I can't go out, \.\. I have homework to do.
I should turn off the TV before I leave.
I can't go out, \.\. I have homework to do.
A
Father: Don't bother me.\.  I'm watching HGTV.
I have a test today.
Father: Huh?\. Oh yeah.\. Well,\. if you've studied like
you should've then you shouldn't be stressed.
(That wasn't very encouraging.)
Hey,\. I'm back.
Father: Oh,\. hey.
(He's not going to ask me how I felt about the test?)
Father: Did you need something?
No.
Father: Hey, son.
Yes?
Father: Make sure you show me your test score when you
get back.
Yes sir.
Father: Hey,\. let me see your test score.
Father: Good,\. I was worried you wouldn't get a perfect
score.
Father: Now keep it up and don't start falling short,\.
ya hear?!
Yes sir.
Father: One wrong isn't too bad but on a test out of 7,\.
it makes more a difference.
Father: Make sure it doesn't happen again.
Yes sir.
Father: What!? \.\. You've been slacking off haven't you!
There should be no reason you are getting scores like
this.
Father: Make sure it doesn't happen again.
Yes sir.
Father: What!? \.\. No son of mine should ever fail a test!\.\.
I oughtta take that laptop away since you can't seem to
pass a simple test!!
But, I need it for homework!
Father: Clearly not!  \.\.I'll let you keep it for now but
if anything like this happens ever again, it's gone!
Yes sir.
Father: I need to make sure I'm raising you right.  \.So
that when you grow up, \.you'll not a be a failure.
Father: I'm beginning to see boys your age starting to
act less and less like men.\.  And I don't want you
following suit.
Father: You're a man,\. remember that.
Father: Your job as a man is to uphold national and
international order in society.
Father: You got me?!
Father: You don't what!?
I don't know if I can be kind of person.\.\.  I don't think
that's right for me.
Father: You're worthless!
Father: I'm telling you what's right for you!
Bu-\^
Father: No buts!  \.You have to fill your role in society!
Father: You know what,\.\. I can't argue with you right now.\.
Go to your room and do your homework,\. if that is really
what you do.
Father: I gotta get back to watching HGTV.
I have a test today.
